intro: Conradia scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf conradia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as streambanks and meadows. Conradia scabra is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
